alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 7:51PM PDT until further notice by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northwest California, including the following counties, in central California, Lake. In northwest California, Humboldt, Mendocino and Trinity. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Minor flooding in highway 1 along Gracia River near Point Arena. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 750 PM PDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - At 750 PM PDT Tuesday, The Garcia River stage was 12.5 feet. Flooding is already occurring in the Highway 1 along the Garcia River. Some location that will experience flooding include...mainly rural areas of South Central Mendocino County. http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ukiah, Fort Bragg, Willits, Point Arena, Laytonville, Ukiah Municipal Airport, Covelo, Albion, Potter Valley, Philo, Boonville, Rockport, Hopland, Leggett, Gualala, Redwood Valley, Comptche, Calpella, Dos Rios and Navarro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
